Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Susan O
Reviews.Content: The hotel I wanted to book was full so the travel agent assisting me recommended this hotel. He set our expectations pretty high and we paid more for it. Decor was cute, staff was helpful enough but that wasn't enough to redeem this place. Bed was concave and we could feel the springs poking us. We barely slept the entire trip. Wires hanging out on the towel warmer looked dangerous. The in-room safe was broken and appears to have been broken for a long time. Toilet paper was moldy. There was broken glass on the floor when we got in (looked like a broken lightbulb but all bulbs were in working order) and some trash on the floor that looked like it fell out when housekeeping was cleaning. We were told the hotel was adjacent to the Arc de Triomphe - not quite. It's about a ten minute walk away - as are all the restaurants. Internet access was not working the entire time we were there and there did not appear to be any effort to fix it. Breakfast was included but was not good. Coffee was all gone at 9am - supposed to be open until 10am. We wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: elizabethsmum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Hotel Amarante Arc de Triomphe we were away on a 3 night romantic getaway, we had a lovely time in Paris the hotel was very nice it was not WOW but it was nice, we were on the 4th floor, the hotel states that it is a non smoking but when we arrived our room stunk of cigarettes not great when I have been 6 months smoke free! The arc de triomph was a 10 min walk away (come out the main door turn right walk to the end of the street take another right and you will see it at the end) The supermarket across the road is convenient but for restaurants there are not many close by and the resturant that was opposite was closed 2 nights out of the 3 (sat,sunday) there was a nice Italian around the corner that we ate at twice they make a lovely spag bol! If I was to go back to Paris I probably wouldn’t stay again but that is because we have seen it now and I dont think it was a 4 star feel. On my last morning my hubby went to get me a cup of coffee and we were charged 4 euros for a tiny coffee! We also asked if we could have a later check out (the hotel was no where near full) we were told No unless we paid 70 more euros! We did ask for some extra pillows and 1 was delivered within mins. If you want a hotel that is pretty local and not too wow-ey this is for you. Staff were helpful enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not four star”
Reviews.Author: Robyn L
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three nights. The rooms were definitely not four star. The toilet leaked which showed obvious signs of prior repair, the heated towel rail, the electrics did not looks safe so we did not use this. We told the reception about the toilet on checking out and got no real response. Housekeeping would have been aware as it was obvious there was a problem with water leaking onto the floor. The overall decor of the room was also quiet old. However, overall the staff were friendly and we had breakfast daily which was adequate for the size of the hotel. The supermarket opposite was useful, however there are not many restaurants in the area. We did eat at the one opposite on two evenings which was good with the lady very friendly. Would not go back - location also even though we can access metro's easily, still felt we were not central to main attractions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzz36f
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. The room was a little small but very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK and not real value for money unless you can get rooms for under $180.00 Aus”
Reviews.Author: Lookim
Reviews.Content: Location was ok, 5 minutes from metro and 15 minute walk to Arc De Triomphe. Some pluses, supermarket across the road which has everything you need and a laundromat around the corner. Bar fridge wad good and air condition worked in our room. Not sure about the stains on the bed cover but our linen was clean and bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, cute and a good base to see most of Paris from”
Reviews.Author: Melanie R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in December 2010. We booked online and had never been here before. We were so pleasantly surprised! Out room was so Paris chic, cute and comfy. The breakfast that was included was lovely and always plentiful every day. It was a great base to see Paris from, close to the Metro, landmarks, restaurants, shops and supermarkets. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: 1BAMBAM1
Reviews.Content: Very clean, comfortable and cosy. We had a good sleep a delicious breakfast and everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “!!!it is no way to come back sgain there”
Reviews.Author: salkharji_saad
Reviews.Content: this hotel is no more than 2 star , house keeping is disturbing your sleep and one black lady is very rude and dirty no room service after 6 pm no free wi-fi and it will cost about 8 euro per day the small restaurant is working during breakfast time only the room is very small and poorly furnished

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the business traveller looking for location and value, don't expect any frills.”
Reviews.Author: JeanLapin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June on business and found the location excellent both for business and some quick shopping. A 20 minute walk to the Champs Elysees. Hotel was reasonably priced for us at the time, but can vary quite a lot (Paid €110 per night). A clean and very quiet room made for a good night's sleep. The room was surprisingly big for a centrally located hotel in Paris. There are many good bistros in the area for breakfast or snacks. This is a no frills hotel, perfect for business but not for a romantic week end.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable room”
Reviews.Author: janice_in_pcola
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights at the hotel and just loved it. When we checked in, the girl at the desk was very nice and later that day when we were leaving to explore the city she gave us a map and explained how to use the metro. The room itself was small but just perfectly decorated and very comfortable beds. The windows opened up to the quiet street below and was just picture perfect with the pretty red flowers in the flower boxes. It is a bit of a walk to the Arc but I would still recommend staying here. Good pastry shop up the street on the corner and a very good Italian restaurant just across from it. Was a wonderful stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't See What The Complaints are About”
Reviews.Author: Gordiep13
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by the travel agent and after reading the reviews was not expecting a lot. When we arrived the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room had everything we needed with enough space for the 2 of us. Our bathroom was very clean with the towels changed daily. The wifi is quite expensive but we were there to see Paris and not log onto Facebook. Breakfast is good enough with some hot food and all the other things you expect from a breakfast buffet. Location is excellent with it being a 1km walk from the Arc de Triomphe and also a 3min walk to the Pereire Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Things stolen at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ioanbudura
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 13th to 15th of may. It was ok, in view of the fact that we left early in the morning and came back late evening. Sad thing, in the last day of our stay we found out that the bottle of Lollita Lempika that we brought from home has dissapeared from the table. We contacted the reception who made one inquiery and told us that they dont know what happened to the perfume. So it was a very dissapointing and surrealist thing to have a bottle of french perfume bought in Bucharest stolen in a Paris hotel. This hotel has a bit of a problem with their perssonel. Avoid this hotel or keep a clear evidence of the stuff you leave in your room.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL I HAVE EVER SEE ...”
Reviews.Author: barbieistanbul
Reviews.Content: I and my fiancee want to go Paris for 2 days , I make reservation , and this hotel have campaign bed & breakfast price and only bed price was the same . I make Bed & berakfast reservation . When we go hotel , resepsiyonist told us , we dont have breakfast , only bad . We said the price was the same , there is some misteke ,today it is Saturday we can not reach anybody from acency . They said we cant don any thing . . . Then we went to our room , room was terible , bed smell , stains on blanket , carpet , Old fashion decoration etc . We said 3 times to reseption to clean room and change blankets , they never do ... This hotel must be 2 * not 4 * ... Never go to this hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Standard”
Reviews.Author: gbatchelor
Reviews.Content: Been in this hotel for business. A few words: old, badly maintained, dirty...The only positive is maybe the breakfast but not great either for 19 Euros...Not a great place at all...To be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure there are worse places to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cbert
Reviews.Content: The hotel (like many others that I have read about) was older and not terribly well kept. The mattress was dirty (stained) and uncomfortable based on normal "4-Star" standards. The room was very small (not much room for anything other than the full sized bed) and bathroom needed some TLC (the toilet was not bolted to the floor and the tub would not drain). For the price, it left a lot to be desired. (In the States this would be a 2-Star, $39.99/night hotel at best.) That said, the location was more on the positive side...roughly a 1/4 mile from the Metro and a mile from the Arc de Triomph. The neighborhood was fairly quiet and non "touristy" giving more of a local Parisian feel.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: popmotions
Reviews.Content: Very expensive hotel. Like other comments point, this is not a 4* hotel at all. Rooms are clean, kind of good location, but prices are out of this planet. In three simple words, Book other hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations if you aren't expecting the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: slub007
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in this hotel for three days and it was a quaint, small hotel with decent rooms and decent service. In other words, it's pretty much like any European hotel. This is NOT a 4 star property but it's clean and located within walking distance of the Arc de Triomphe (20 minutes or so). I wish I could rate this as good and not average or excellent. That's exactly what it was. The staff was hot and cold. Some were friendly, some were lukewarm. The breakfast was average or below, internet access was relatively cheap. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location NOT central”
Reviews.Author: JoanneOS
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel if staying in Paris. The location is just not central. Everything is at least 20 minutes in the metro and there isnt anything to do in the vicinity of the hotel. Booked it on lastminute.com as a last resort. It was disguised as a 'top secret' hotel. The room was basic and the hotel in general would not intice anyone to hang around there for anything other than sleep. If I was going again I would stay somewhere more in central Paris as I think it makes a big difference to your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Stars Hotel in any way”
Reviews.Author: KarY75
Reviews.Content: The only 2 advantages about this hotel is the location as well as a good sized bedroom by French standards. Otherwise it is far from being a 4 stars hotel. It all started when my husband booked online using the direct hotel website for a weekend offer which stated that buffet breakfast was included as well as two days metro passes for 2 persons. Upon arrival the recepionist completely denied the offer part concerning the transportation in a very sharp tone. The following day we showed her the Amarante website and she was totally surprised. We asked her to talk to her manager to remove this from their website as it is false advertisement. She didn't even have the courtesy to apologize about this error and the next thing she did was utterly insulting (she offered us money to go buy the metro passes!) My husband told her it's not the matter of the money and that we expected at least an apology. Apart from this incident, 1) The hotel has no bell captain/concierge 2) Rooms need total refurbishment (e.g. new sheets/bedding/towels) 3) Elevator needs servicing (very slow & makes loud sounds) I have travelled extensively around the globe and know what kind of services/amenities to expect.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mathuranup
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris and this hotel. Very friendly staff, great breakfast, spacious and modern bathroom, and a quiet and convenient location all made it a wonderful stay. The rooms are on the smaller side, however I experienced similar sized rooms in many more expensive hotels in other european cities. I will recommend this hotel without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute joke”
Reviews.Author: kenji8888
Reviews.Content: After being advertised as a "top secret hotel in a central location near the Arc de triomphe" - I was sold onto buying this flight and hotel package from lastminute dot com. Having never been in Paris before, I thought that the Arc de triomphe was in central Paris, but I had learnt that the heart of the city was around Notre Dame, on the other side of the river, no where near this hotel at all. Luckily the Paris transport system was efficient! After visiting 4 star hotels within my previous travels, I would have thought there would be at least a conceirge opening doors or carrying our luggage etc. This so called "4 star hotel" lacked such facilities. You may call me snobbish but this was the least of my concerns within this hotel, there are more to follow! Before this trip, I had read up and heard it all about the Parisian arrogance against foreign tourists. However I never would have thought there would be such problem within a four star hotel, how wrong was I! The staff were unfriendly and I had felt extremely unwelcome after asking where the nearest currency exchange were. However, I had found the night staff to be the completely opposite to their day time colleagues. I just have to reiterate what other people have said in regards to the rooms. No way in this world that this is a 4 star hotel, the beds were uncomfortable and itchy. We didn't have one good night sleep for the duration of our stay. Not only that, the cleaners don't clean the rooms properly, it was clear that the bedding was rushed on our second day. The only good thing was that they had a powerful but basic shower. The breakfast was limited to cold food, not worth the 19 euros per head to say the least. To end our nightmare, the fire alarm was setted off without warning on our last day. We got woken up at 6am after getting in late. The amount of people staying at this hotel confirmed the reputation of this hotel, there was only about 5 rooms (there are 50 rooms in this hotel) being vacated. They must have been other unfortunate people like us who fell for this cheap package! After the fire alarm turned off we were told we can go back to the rooms. There was no apology or explanation to why this had happened apart from a vague, "our fire alarms are sensitive." Although I had such a torrid time, I was safely say that all of the above are genuine and I haven't exaggerated anything. I have now learnt my lesson in never be lazy again and buy a package from lastminute dot com. And I will now end with one advice, do not come here!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveller53
Reviews.Content: The hotel was, overall, very clean and situated in a quiet residential street. Our bedroom overlooked the road at the front of the hotel - the view was not outstanding in any way, in fact it was quite a dreary outlook. The bedroom, although adequate, was extremely small and in need of some refurbishment - but the bathroom was very nice, quite spacious and fairly modern. The hotel staff were pleasant enough, but not overly friendly or helpful. The Arc de Triomphe was a good 20 minutes walk from the hotel, but there was a nearby Metro approximately 5 minutes walk away. On reflection, I have to say that the room rates for this hotel are probably very over-priced for what you get. Although advertised as a 4 star hotel, by UK standards it would probably only pass as a good 2 star. There was nothing really wrong with this hotel - but, again, there wasn't anything to really like about the place. Our stay was pleasant enough, but I don't think it is somewhere I would return to or, indeed, confidently recommend.

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: LuskaHyzka
Reviews.Content: I liked the size of the hotel very much. It didn't have many rooms and I felt cosy there. The room was very, but very small. 50 cm on both sides of the bed, maybe a meter at the end. Bathroom - small but warm and clean, with all the amenities. I loved their breakfasts. Huge choice (scrambled eggs, sausages, cheese, marmalade), baguettes, many types of fruit or black tea. We were usually the last ones coming and still had our choice. 10 minutes walk to Arc the Triomphe, there is the metro station about 5 minutes from the hotel. To be honest we mostly walked all the time anyway. As we were out all the time, we could cope with the room size but I would be probably too claustrophobic in case I would need to stay there all day. I agree with many reviewers, not sure about 4*, but definitely higher range of 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with all necessities for a pleasant week in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: boileralum13
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was great. The street was incredibly quiet at night and we rarely heard the guests in other rooms. The price was a great deal for this area. I agree with the other reviews that it wasn't quite a 4-star, but we anticipated this going in and weren't really looking for that nice of a hotel. More of a 3-star hotel. The rooms were cleaned every day and were spotless. Bathroom was very nice, always had hot water, pressure was good, towel-warmer was great. Replaced shampoo, gel, soap, etc. every day. The concierge was very pleasant and spoke English when we arrived and allowed us to check-in early (2PM, 3PM check-in). When we were checking out and the elevator was out-of-service because they were switching out the carpet, it would've been nice if they had offered to help us carry some of our luggage down the stairs. We did not try the breakfast and we were comfortable with venturing out around the neighborhood and we're glad we did. If you take a left leaving the hotel, immediate right and immediate left into the Marchel Juin square (Perriere Metro stop) there are several shops along the way, including a bakery, wine shop, cheese shop and Monoprix, a grocery store for cheap snacks, wine, beer, cookies, etc. which also make good gifts. The Perriere Metro stop is 2-3 minutes away in the Marchel Juin square. The Arc is a 10-minute walk and the Eiffel Tower is about 20 minutes. Otherwise the metro stop gets you to all the hot spots with 2 line-switches at the most. Rue de Neil and Mac Mahon, the main streets that lead you down to the Arc, have some good shops and restaurants, but it seems to be a lower-key area in general, but you have to try the Aux Armes de Neil bakery, just around the corner from the hotel and across Neil. The staff is incredibly friendly, speak enough English, and the food was amazing! Bacinos was our favorite restaurant, again, great food, very friendly and attentive staff that spoke very good English, and THE best creme brulee we've ever eaten! Go left out of hotel, immediate right and it's on the right. Prices in this area were reasonable for the area, but Monoprix was a nice "financial" break at times, and we still got to sample French wine, bread, jam and cheese in our hotel room as a snack or as a nightcap, which meant not having to give in to paying for the room's mini-bar. If you depend on hotel staff for a lot of direction and information, or spend a lot of time in your hotel, this might not be the place for you. It was a very nice hotel and the staff was very friendly and we would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Jx2London
Reviews.Content: Not a great location, certainly further from main attractions than lastminute made it sound. Unfriendly service all round, especially when checking out (not even a smile!). Room was very average, and as the air conditioner did not work, the room was unbearably hot. When we complained about this, we were told that nothing could be done. We ended up opening windows, which let in the noise from the street. This hotel is NOT four stars and would never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars?”
Reviews.Author: john2445
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good 10 minute power walk from the arc de triomph but about 3 minutes from the metro stop Pereire. I booked with Zoo paying 138 euro inc breakfast. In retrospect a hotel closer to ther city centre would have been better. The room was small but very clean with flat screen tv and mini-bar. The bathroom had a small bath with shower fitting with plenty of hot water. The staff were polite and friendly. The breakfast was excellent with scrambled eggs, sausage and bacon, fresh fruit salad, pastries juice and coffee. Even better it served from 06:30 till 10:30 so you could lie-in if you wanted to and not be disturbed by the staff. In summary, clean, good staff, great breakfast but a little too far out of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel, in an authentic location”
Reviews.Author: AllyCaddy
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris on a 3 night stay with my husband and we stayed at the Amarante Arc De Triomphe Hotel. We took the Metro to the Hotel, which we found with ease. We went from the Gard Nord. The hotel is a 3 min walk from the Metro stop. You can take a taxi but who knows what they charge?! The Metro is 1.5 for one trip. At the hotel were greeted by friendly staff, and made aware that someone would always be around if needed. Their English is very good, and if you attempt some French greetings (Bonjour, Bon Soir) it is always welcome and appreciated. The room is clean and of a good size. We were on the ground floor but found there to be no noise from the road outside. The room included the usual toiletries, towels, hairdryer, flat screen TV and mini bar. But (and this is where I agree that I would consider this a 3star hotel and not 4star) there were no tea and coffee making facilities, or room service, but… and here’s and unexpected twist, the drinks in the mini bar fridge are cheaper than the bars/café’s in Paris so you may wish to have a tipple before you leave your room. The water was hot at all hours of the day, the towels were fresh and clean, as was the bedding. I did not consider the mattress un-comfortable at all. The hotel is perfectly adequate for a short stay in Paris. Though for all you lovers out there… this is not a ‘romantic’ hotel, think NOVOTEL, basic and clean. The hotel does not have all the little extra touches you may expect from a high ‘starring’ hotel, but its all you need. AND its not noisy, no doors banging, or people lodly walking along corridors, we slept very well. There are lots of reviews about the breakfast, as our was included in the price we found it perfectly adequate, with the usual meat, cereal, fruit, pastries, bread, eggs, sausages and yoghurts. You go up and help yourself. But we would also recommend finding somewhere local to have breakfast if this is not included in your deal. The sur-rounding area also makes the hotel a great stay. A hop skip and a jump away are a wide selection of authentic Parisian Café’s. They are welcoming of tourists and will make you feel very welcome. We recommend café Richard, we sat outside and watched the world go by. There are no tacky tourist cafes as there were in the main tourist hot spots of Paris, no beggars on the street or tatty souvenir shops it was a proper taste of Paris. Even with our very limited French, we conversed with the locals who were all lovely. There is also a near by Monoprix (think French Co-Op or Spa) only 1 min walk from the hotel, which has all the essentials you may need. There are also patisseries and other small shops in the local area to the hotel. We enjoyed our stay very much and will happily use this hotel again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr_and_Mr
Reviews.Content: Not just to repeat what others have said, but this is not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination and the air conditioner did not work the first night. The hotel did not offer to do anything to solve this problem aside from telling us to open the windows. Dont waste your money on the hotel breakfast, since it is overpriced and not very good and there is a wonderful pastry shop on the corner. Also, the shower head was broken. I dont recommend this hotel to anyone for any reason unless it is free and then, still I would thin twice since the be was a box of rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel falsely rated a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: PoBlazers
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through hotwire where they display just the star rating before booking it. Hotwire claimed that the hotel was in the same class as Omni, Intercontinental, Hyatt and when I bid, it came up with this hotel wrongly calssified as 4 star by whoever. Hotwire wouldn't change or cancel even after showing them the bad reviews on tripadvisor. The price offered by Hotwire was tiny bit lower than the rate that the hotel advertises on their website. The rooms are tiny and there is nothing called a view. For an extra bed they charged me an additional 50 Euro. To get around the city, you almost had to tickle the person at the reception for getting any information out of him. The metro is pretty close to the hotel. Arc de Triomphe and champs Elysees are within walking distance too(20mins). You can hail a cab to get to most sites like Louvre etc and it wouldn't cost you much. So, location wise, it is not a bad pick, but don't expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased”
Reviews.Author: POFive
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for five nights, and we were very satisfied. The location is in a quit area at the 17em. 15 min. walk to the Arc de Triomphe & Champs-Élysées Avenue. 5 min. walk to metro – Periere. The room was clean and warm, and was arranged and cleaned every day. The bathroom had all the necessary equipment: shampoo, soap, cleansing gel etc. The towel warmer in the bathroom was great. The water was always hot and the pressure was also very good. There are many supermarkets around (one of them KOSHER). Also, a nearby fnac eveil&jeux (toy) shop. Stuff in the dinning room and in the reception was very polite and helpful. Breakfast was part of our deal and it was good, but it's not worth 22 euro. instead you can buy food in the Boulangerie-Patisserie. There is a taxi service from the hotel to CDG airport for 34 euro (2 persons).

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, if you can get into your room...”
Reviews.Author: karmonika
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling across Europe for the last 5 weeks and have not had one problem with our accomodation - until now. We stayed here for 4 nights during our honeymoon in Europe. For 2 out of the 4 nights we could not get into our room as the key woudn't work. The first time it happened, reception tried to get the room open for us and eventually succeeded after several hours, but by then our dinner plans had been ruined. The second time it happened, we arrived back at our hotel we found the problem had not been fixed. So AGAIN we had to change our plans to wait until the guy in reception got it fixed. The second time round, the reception staff were very unhelpful, one staff member indicated they'd had previous problems with this same room. This time, once they got the door open the staff went in and picked up all of our belongings (while we were gone) and put them in a new room....we asked for a discount on the room rate but were told we would have to write a letter to managment to ask for this. They showed no understanding and were not very apologetic about it at all. Choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel that gets the job done, but does not impress”
Reviews.Author: sokasenbei
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews have already said, this is not a 4-star hotel. We also booked this through a Hotwire deal and I will never use Hotwire again because of this...kind of feel tricked. The hotel itself is not difficult to get to from the airport, take the RER B line and the local trains to the Pereire station. Takes about an hour or less. Check in was normal, of course the staff speaks English(they better, it's a hotel!). Our room was a standard size room for a European hotel. This was our first time in Paris, but we have travelled to Europe before. If you compare it to a standard US hotel room, it is small. There is no pool or gym. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel! It's 22 Euros and there are plenty of bakeries/markets/cafes around that serve better food for less money. There is a small mini bar fridge in the room, which we used to keep our water that we bought at the market cold. There is internet access you can purchase at around 20 Euro for 24 hours....rip off! The safe in the room did not work. The shower pressure in the bathroom was very good. The towel warmer in the bathroom was nice also. The weird "half" shower doors are standard. I still don't understand these doors, they allow water to get all over the floor. Some wallpaper was fading and ugly, but who cares about wallpaper. Anyway, think Holiday Inn Express. It will give you a good place to rest at night, but will not give your spouse/girlfriend the feeling that you splurged on her. Room cleaning was normal. We went out and saw the sights all day and returned to a clean nice room. The Arc de Triomphe is a 15 minute walk. There are local bakeries, cafe's, and a supermarket nearby. The area is mostly residential with upper class apartments everywhere. We felt very safe walking around at night time. The road the hotel is on can be loud with cars honking in the daytime, but at night time we slept just fine, no loud noises. After spending a week in Paris, I think I will try and stay in the Latin Quarter or Marais next time. There is nothing wrong with this area, but it's a bit more residential and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but pricey”
Reviews.Author: BearsdenBrian
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the May holiday weekend and overall the experience was average. I agree that by any other standards this is not a 4 star hotel. I'd give it 3. No problems with the staff of service because we didn't use any. The small bar in the reception area was unmanned and unused for the 3 days of our stay. Breakfast at 22 euros was a no-go area. far better to visit one of the many cafes in the surrounding area for breakfast. the location was fine and there are 2 metro stops nearby. The room was OK, if a little small. The old fashioned TV didn't have any english speaking channels unfortunately. The bathroom was clean and tidy with good shower etc however the door squeaked so much it could wake you up if you partner took a leak in the night. (Sorry). At approx £100 per night I suppose it's OK for Paris but a bit on the pricey side for what you get. We found Paris quite expensive this time because of the exchange rate. However, for really good value meals we found that the Japanese restaurants near the hotel were very good and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Go Back”
Reviews.Author: ahnak
Reviews.Content: The bedding and carpet in the hotel room was absolutely horrible. Booked through hotwire and was very disappointed. The staff was generally unhelpful and one was actually quite condescending. I would stay far away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Big Rooms, Location is OK!!”
Reviews.Author: Serge77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days in March. It was booked through Hotwire and I don't really needs to be considered as a four star. Its more like a three star. The arrival and check in were not so great, granted we arrived around 8am and the room would not be ready till after 1pm. The hotel is in a fairly quite area, there was no loud noises at night or anytime that kept us up. We were able to leave our bags and off we went. Once we returned, the room was ready and the was very spacious, not very typical of european hotels. The room's wallpaper did have some wear and tear, but who really cares about minimal rips. The bathroom itself was not huge but the heated bath towel holder was a nice touch. The only issue with the bathroom was the tub. It can be quite dangerous stepping in and out of the tub, it seemed like it was situated bit high. Once had to take a giant step up and down getting in and out of the tub. Which is kind of strange because I have never seen a bath tub that sat up that high. They hotel supplys fairly nice toiletries, they all smell the same. The closet space was ample for two people and to store two suitcases. There also was a safe, in the room. Unable to store a laptop in there. The charge for wireless was ridiculous. I was able to get a signal with my Iphone but declined paying for their service. We didn't try the breakfast at the hotel. There is a great bakery around the corner from the hotel. The crossiants and baguettes were awesome. There is also a Monoprix (supermarket) around the corner, to stock up on drinks. The metro stop (Pereire sp?) was close by and one can navigate from there pretty well. The C line train one should get on is called NORA. We had some trouble the first night getting back to the hotel fromt he Eiffel Tower stop. Nora stops running after awhile. The hotel is great for family and if you want to be away from hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel is about 5-10 min walk to the Arc de Triomphe, but that is the only major atrraction that is near by. I have stayed in the Latin Quarter before and I prefer to stay there. The only thing about the hotel that irked me was the front desk. They were not helpful at all on directions. They actually got me lost twice and decided not to ask them anymore questions after that. Overall, the hotel was a nice quiet place to come and rest your head at the end of the day. I never felt that rooms to be dirty or dingy, I had a room on the second floor and had no problems with noise from the street. I got my reservation through Hotwire so the price was not to bad. I wouldn't pay 4 star price for this hotel. If you can get a deal on the price I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boyfriend bought pajama bottoms just to sleep in bed!”
Reviews.Author: kdubCalgary
Reviews.Content: A travel agency booked this hotel for us, and when we looked at the pictures it seemed ok , and knowing it was a 4 star we thought a picture might not due it justice. Unfortunately we were wrong. This hotel was very expensive for what you got. The mattress was about 3 inches thick, and there were numerous "unkown" stains on the covers. I am usually easily satisfied with most hotel beds, but the sheets felt like paper. If you wanted to freshen up by having a bath or shower after 8:00pm forget it, the hot water was turned off. Enjoying the breakfast would have cost us 22 euro's per person, when there were numerous places to eat in the area for at least half the price. Hotel staff seemed average. The only thing I liked about the hotel was it's location. It is a small walk to The Arc De Triomphe, and close to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “nice short business stay”
Reviews.Author: Zoeboey
Reviews.Content: I had a very plesant 3 night stay here for business. The hotel reception staff were friendly, the rooms are on the small side but nicely decorated (in a traditional style) and I very much appreciated my bath after a long days work. Nice clean bathrooms, good power and temparature on the shower. TV's are a bit old though and mine broke twice during my stay (they fixed it quikly, but didn't replace it so it broke again). breakfast was adequate (3 types of ceral, bread and jam, many different types of pastries, yoghurt, fruit, chees, ham etc) and the service was quick for the hot drinks. There is no restaurant at the hotel, but hey - you're in Paris, you should get out and about to sample the restaurants in the area. All in all a nice stay in a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Lusen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long week-end and found it very nice. What we appreciated the most was that is was very quiet. The staff was friendly and spoke English. The rooms were rather small, but clean and comfortable. Breakfast was not bad if you consider what French breakfast usually consist of.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: Em2008Newcastle
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend in Paris and were incredibly disappointed with it. We travel frequently and always stay in 4* hotels and this was most definitely not a 4* hotel. The rooms were extremely small and the decor was shabby with wallpaper peeling off the walls, the bed linen looked like it had seen better days and the safe was broken. The service from the staff is not what I would expect from a 4* hotel either – one evening we rang reception and asked if there was an iron available, we were told there was but only if we came down and got it ourselves. I would also avoid breakfast – on offer there was tea, coffee, juices, bread, boiled eggs and continental style meat all for the somewhat hefty fee of 22 Euros per person. If you do stay in this hotel you are far better off grabbing coffee and a pastry from one of the many patisseries you will walk past on the 10 minute (at a brisk walking pace) walk to the Arc de Triomphe every morning – yes the name of the hotel is rather a stretch! So, in summary I really wouldn’t recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AleksandarS
Reviews.Content: Well it is a small hotel, the service is excellent , maybe little bit pricey but it is understandable because of its very good location. It is located some 10 minutes walking to Arc de Triopmhe, and just near corner to Avenue Wagram. The staff are very polite, breakfast is buffet. Solid choice

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NMGtravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of March 2008. I booked it last minute on Hotels.com and was happy with my stay. I had a room with a single bed on the 1st floor (above the ground floor) overlooking the street. It was clean, smartly furnished, and comfortable. The location was ideal. In a quiet residential neighborhood, just a 5 minute walk away from the Pereire Metro station. There was a quaint boulangerie on the corner, as well as a cute place to get pate and a fruit stand nearby. A supermarket and atm were around the corner, which made things extremely convenient. The hotel staff were courteous and friendly. I thought the price of the room was a little expensive. When I mentioned this to the man at the desk at checkout, he recommended that I call if I'd like to stay again, that I could negotiate a nightly rate of around 150 euros, including breakfast, depending on the length of my stay. I only ate at the breakfast once, as it was 12 euros per person, and wasn't really worth it. The cute cafe on the Pereire circle were much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what this hotel offers”
Reviews.Author: mistok
Reviews.Content: I suggest not to book this hotel if you can go in others in Paris centre. It is very expensive but it doesn't offer what 240 € per night could get you think.... If you book a 3 stars hotel in the vicinity you will save a lot of money and maybe you'll experience a better service. I went to this hotel for the last days of the year 2007 and this is maybe the reason for the very expensive tarif. Breakfast was not included, but it costed 22 € per person per day and we were obliged to go and have breakfast in a bar in the vicinities (where we payed a quarter...). Then there was a ridicolous problem with the keys of the rooms: they didn't open your door each time you tried to.... And each time you were obliged to go to the reception and ask for help. The room, on the other hand, was clean and comfortable, even if quite poor for a 4 stars hotel in the centre of Paris. Again, book a 3 stars hotel in the same area and you will visit marvellous Paris saving money and avoiding troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jnikjnik
Reviews.Content: Booked this very nice hotel through a third party web-site for Fri-Sat nights paying €160 per night without breakfast. I'd say it's about the max price you want to pay for this property, and you get your value for the money. The room was nice and clean looking onto the quiet street which the hotel is on. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The location of the hotel is great as you're just several blocks (and a nice walk) away from Arc de Triomphe and yet in a quiet area away from the tourists. From "the Arc" you can either explore the rest of the city by foot or catch the Metro which will take you anywhere along Champs-Elysées. We love walking, so only took the metro back to the "Arc" one evening coming back from St Germain via Place de la Concorde. Alternatively can catch the Metro from Courcelles to Sacre Coeur (takes no time) If you go "left-right-left" from the hotel you have a super-market right around the corner, and few metres further you're at Place du Maréchal Juin - which is a roundabout with a very wide selection of resataurants and bars if you want something close. We did enjoy our stay at the hotel with the exception of a couple of minor problems i must mention to make the review fair: - The basin in the bathroom was leaking water onto the floor, so it was getting somewhat flooded after use; and - The safe in the room didn't seem to want to co-operate This is what brought my rating from 4 down to a 3, but all and all we were not bothered by it! The stnd rate for breakfast is €22 or €12 if you book via internet (not sure how it works) but you get a unusually large (for France) breakfast with scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon, sausages, cereal, a small selection of cheeses and cold cuts, pastries and juices. All was very nice!! Just make sure you are aware in advance if you room rate includes breakfast or how much it will be. Depends if you prefer the convenience of the in-house breakfast or if you'd rather go out for something more "local".

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: clive-thomas
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife enjoyed our 3 day stay here,the location is in a quiet area and only 5 minutes from the metro,we payed 11 euro per day for the both of us to use the metro daily,the hotel charged us 83 euro for breakfast for 2 for 3 days,you can really fill yourself up on this and set your self up for the day. We booked Airport Connection shuttle bus company from cdg airport and they were on time and very profesional I would recomend them for first timers however If I go back I feel confident now to get the train and the metro if you book this hotel you wont go far wrong,hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: HERSHAMBOY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days over Christmas. The Hotel is warm, quiet and well placed for travelling around Paris, especially if you like to use the Metro. The rooms are clean , light and airy, although they are extremely small considering this is supposed to be 4 star, which I think is very generous. Te staff are courteous, friendly and helpful. Breakfast is very good value and served in a small and bright dining room. I would recommend staying here if you don't mind small hotels and small bedrooms. Only other negatives, were: no remote for the TV and the room safes are not user friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. God location”
Reviews.Author: shiftman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth a vist. The rooms are as shown in the pictures, not large but good storage space. Ideal for any occasion. The staff are very helpfull and breakfast should not be missed. The closest Metro station is Pereire. Just across the road from the Metro is a great restaurant called Petrus. 12 Place Du Marechal Juin. A three course meal plus wine will be about £100 but it is well worth it. We would definatly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “valentines weekend”
Reviews.Author: Manc_Captain_Nemo
Reviews.Content: We checked in late valentines day tired and ready for a shower and something to eat. The staff were all pleasant and helpfull. On entering the room the first thing that struck us was that smell best described as "a Stale drain" after airing the room it seemed to go. Room was basic but we expected that. Everyday it was cleaned and everyday the smell was there on return from our adventures perhaps its some odd detergent they use. Location is fantastic in four days we visited everywhere from Monmartre to the Eiffel. We ate almost every night on the Rue Wagram and the resteraunts were of a high standard. There is an excellent pattiserrie on the junction of Wagram and Pierre!!! Pain o chocolat to die for. Dont expect the hilton think more blackpool B&B and you wont go far wrong. The hotel didnt ruin our fantastic break but it certainly didnt add anything other than a place to stay and wash...

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hdriver
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here on a recent trip to Paris for our silver wedding. Hotel handy for all the sites we wanted to see. Two metro stations near by, found Periere the closest. Very clean throughout and nicely decorated. Breakfast, 12 euro (because we booked over internet) was a good choice of fresh fruit salad, yogurts cereals ham cheese boiled eggs, cooked breakfst if you wanted it and croissants baguettes etc. Plenty of places to eat close by, and also a supermarket for getting the odd bottle of champagne! All staff very friendly, would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: MissGT
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel! Found it through the Eurostar website and upon reading the reviews on here I booked it! Staff were friendly and helpful (calling to make reservations for us in restaurants, tourist attractions/direction advice, etc). The room was sweet, slightly small but we didnt need any bigger, and the bathrobe was incredibly snuggly - could have stayed in it all day. My only complaints would be that there was only one bathrobe, and the minibar was not fully stocked. Other than that I highly recommend - we had a great romantic weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Cute! Cute! Cute! little Moderate hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't like surprises with my room choice and was pleased to discover that this hotel looks exactly like the pictures in the advertisements. The one word that comes to mind to describe this hotel is CUTE! (if you want an ultra modern urban pad or a huge hotel with a grand swanky lobby - this is NOT your hotel) It is a smaller moderate hotel with a small lobby area and newly decorated breakfast room downstairs from the main entrance. The upper halls and rooms had a very feminine (almost bed and breakfast) feel with light blue striped wallpaper, matching light blue toille bedspreads, and cherry furniture. The room is not huge- but that is pretty standard for Europe- it does have a nice size mirrored closet with shelves. The bathroom is not huge, but not as tiny as I've had in Europe- it had a bath and shower combo and followed the blue and white motif- also it was IMMACULATLY clean with all of the fixtures looking new. It is NOT right at the ARC de Triumph, but a bit removed in a quaint (ie quiet- no street noise) little neighborhood about 5 blocks away. However, this location was still good b/c there was a subway station 2 blocks from the hotel and a grocery store less than 1 block from the hotel. This grocery store was great for snacks that didn't break the bank-there is a referigerator in the room. Getting around was not a problem at all. The staff was pleasant and there is a airport transfer service that was reasonable. This is a great little moderate hotel with a lot of thoughtful (boutique) touches- it didn't seem sterile (homey)... I would stay at this darling little hotel again- no question.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but location and quality slightly questionable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When visiting Paris, you want to be close to St Germain and Marais. This Hotel is a little bit out of the way and a pain to travel to and from at night. The hotel was clean and nicely decorated. Booked a double bed and got a twin. They didn't seem to concerned, though the next day they moved our bags with out asking and we were in a slightly larger room with two beds put together! Breakfast is set in a nice lounge, though the cooked breakfast isn't the tastiest. Staff are friendly and helpful. Paris hotels are generally at two ends of the spectrum and this is unusually middle of the road.

HotelInfo.Name: Amarante Pierre Arc de Triomphe
HotelInfo.Address: 25 rue Theodore de Banville | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
